reviewText: Beyonce has skills in the studio, but when it comes to preformance wise, Beyonce has everything: Energy, a voice, dance routines, outfit change, the whole thing.There are three bonus tracks from the bonus disk:01. Wishing On A Star (10/10) - A remake of the original. Beyonce did an excellent job with it.02. What's It Gonna Be? (10/10) - A crazy bass line and Beyonce going in and out of falsetto, there is nothing left from this song. Beyonce killed it. My favorite bonus song.03. My First Time (10/10) - This song was done by the neptunes. Personally, I think this song should've been on "Dangerously In Love" right before "Speechless". It's that first time song about letting him take the lead. Very nice and up-tempo.IF YOU LOVE BEYONCE, YOU SHOULD'VE HAD THIS IN YOUR COLLECTION BY NOW!!!

reviewText: This performance at Wembley is excellent and I surely enjoyed it though, as expected, it's not on par with her later two performances.  That just goes to show that Beyonce was already a major talent many years ago and she has only gotten better with time, experience, and maturity.  Considering that she's still only in her twenties, one can only imagine how good she'll become during the next couple of decades (I predict that you'll hear more jazz elements in her work - check out her amazing scatting in her Vegas performance).  One of the most valuable features of this DVD is the interview with Beyonce, from which it becomes apparent that she's a very grounded person, and I'm sure that's been a major factor in her sustained and growing success.
summary: Great, though her later performances continue to get better
Title: N/A

reviewText: Beyonce is very talented and she just had an amazing year with her multi-platinum album that brought her hits such as "Crazy in love" and "Naughty girl". So now you'll have the chance to see that success on stage.This DVD contains a concert at Wembley stadium, where Beyonce sings almost all her solo songs plus a medley with the best songs of Destiny's Child. The show is very good (not amazing), Beyonce's voice sounds also good, but besides the show I think that the special features are also good with behind the scenes with Beyonce and Beyonce's performance at The Brit Awards 2004.What I think that what's missing in this production are her videos and the rest of the songs that come on "Dangerously in love". Finally you'll get with this DVD a bonus cd that contains: "Wishing on a star", "What's it gonna be", "My first time", "Krazy in luv" and a remix from "Naughty girl".
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am gonna be completely honest in this review. I am a huge Beyonce fan, and i love her music, i think she is hot, i just don't think she performs very well live. I went to the ladies first tour in Oakland, CA last month, and i was very dissapointed with her performance. Thank god Alicia Keys was performing as well, otherwise i would have been pissed. (That girl did amazing.) But anyway this dvd was pretty much the same. It started off pretty good with Baby Boy, Naughty Girl, Fever, and Work it out. She does good with those songs, very entertaining, but then after the ever annoying Hip Hop Star, she goes in to ballad mode, which pretty much puts everone to sleep. But then she wakes us up with a great rendition to her song Speechless which she sings pretty well. And then she loses me again when she sings like 15 seconds from all her previous Destiny's Child songs. From there she does Me, Myself, and I which is another of the million song's she dedicates to "her ladies". She does pretty well with that, and then she performs the cheesy song Summertime which is new to the crowd at the time,and no one really seems to be feeling it. Up next is Beyonce's favorite song Dangerously in Love which she overly sings. She screams the chorus over and over turning the 4 minute song into anywhere between 10-15 minutes. And then finally her grand finale which is Crazy In Love. She wakens me up for this one. I love the way she makes her entrance stares into the crowd with one arm up, and out of nowhere the music comes on and she starts to go right on cue. It looks great. So a little disapointed, but if you are a die hard Beyonce fan, you will love it. I gave it three stars because of the many costume changes she does, and the coming out of the ceiling entrance hanging upsidedown, and the whole lot of unexpected things she does to make an otherwise dull performance a little interesting. Plus you get alot of extra features including a behing the scenes look into getting the show together, some interviews, and a performance to Crazy in Love from the Brit Awards show. It also comes with a cd with some remixes and a few new songs that i wasn't too crazy about.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this collection for the second disc of remixes included here.The real find though is the DVD concert that is the main selling point. Although not as polished as a Cher or Kylie - Beyonce comes off as a hardworking,great voiced young diva waiting and eventually showing the crowd her talent for dancing ,singing and of course like every good diva -the glamour that goes into concerts like this. She changes outfits several times and looks great in each one. This is basically a concert of her Dangerously In Love cd with a Destiny's Child medley thrown in for great effect. Love the Bob Fosse- Sweet Charity  number during "Yes".The cd is the main point of me buying this and in it you get a new cover of the Classic "Wishing On A Star" made famous by Rose Royce /The Cover Girls(depending on if you are a 70's or a 90's music fan) plus two new songs. The remixes are for "Krazy In Love"(Maurice's Nu Soul Mix- 6:29),"Baby Boy" (Junior's World Mixshow Mix-6:38) and the new and so far only on import remix for "Naughty Girl"(Caldrone/Quayle Club Mix- a full 9:39). Missing is a remix for "Me,Myself And I" but still a great little ep of new stuff and mixes.
summary: Dvd concert plus cd of bonus songs and remixes.

reviewText: This dvd is quite good, although I was expecting more from Beyonce as a performer. Maybe I put my expectations too high. Usually when I buy a live dvd, I am expecting something that will keep me entertain from beginning to end (like Madonna's concerts). At times, I had to press the "skip" button because Beyonce was boring me. Another disappointment (this didn't surprise me)is Beyonce over-singing her songs. I find this quite annoying because she doesn't have the range or the style to pull this off. It comes off to showy and it makes her sound like she is struggling. With the exception of her live performance, I think the addition of the bonus cd and the backstage footage made this dvd worth the price. Beyonce is still young, so I will give her time to grow as an artist. After all, not everyone can expect to be a Madonna or Janet so soon in his or her career.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Beyoncé. A name that almost everyone in the world is familiar with. She had one of the number one album's in 2003 with "Dangerously In Love". This DVD is the MUST HAVE addition to go along with the CD "Dangerously In Love". This DVD brings the CD alive. She puts all of her effort into pleasing her British audience. The show kicks off with the oh-so-sexy "Baby Boy". This DVD also made me come to like the song "Hip Hop Star" than I did at first. She does a DC Medley which includes Bug A Boo; No, No, No Pt. 2; Bootylicious; Jumpin', Jumpin'; Say My Name; Independent Women Pt 1; '03 Bonnie &Clyde; and Survivor. "Dangerously In Love 2" is one of the most beautiful performances I've ever seen. Many people who reviewed this say that Janet's concerts are better. Beyoncé gives the same amount of effort as Janet if not more. This is a MUST HAVE for your collection.

reviewText: Beyonce is very beautiful and I liked this DVD.  She was very emotional when she sung and I liked seeing all her pretty and sexy outfits.  It's nice to have some visuals when listening to her music.  I did not give her five stars because many times she would not sing and ask the audience to say the lyrics... that was annoying-I couldn't even hear the lines, I just wanted to hear Beyonce sing.  Also, when she was singing some of those wonderful hits from Destiny's Child she wouldn't finish the songs... she starts and never finishes... this was annoying!!However, the best thing about the DVD was the extras.  Beyonce talked about how she chose all her outfits, her routines, etc.  These extras were very long and interesting.  It gave me a lot of insight into Beyonce and her love of musicals.  She is actually an artist and appreciates good classic performances.  Overall, a decent DVD by the beautiful Beyonce.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD got me all riled up for nothing but dissappointment. She wore the same old tired costume(i.e. the red genie pants) for Baby Boy and Naughty Girl. Beyonce wants to do things too big and she only has one CD out at the moment. Why does she have the feeling that she can do big shows when she's only been an solo entertainer for a year. Her wardrobe was totally out of sync with some of her songs(i.e. Hip hop star she was dressed like a Broadway chorus dancer). Also, the yellow dress had to go. However, the worse dress on that list was the "plucked chiken dress" she wore for Dangerously In Love. I regret buying this and her performances need serious work if she actually thought the routine of the girls leaning over a bar was "deep" on Say Yes. I got tired of the long blonde weave/wig-which ever it is! She really needs to learn an instrument or have more visual stimuli than just shaking it up on stage and thinking that her over-vibrato-tizing singing will do the trick.All in all, the best performances on the DVD was "A Gift from Virgo" and "Fever". Baby Boy and Crazy and Dangerously have been played to the point of no salvation. True artistry lies in the heart and not corny lyrics and pop-manufactured music.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Beyonce's solo album was the biggest thing of 2003. I've purchased it, only to find it to be so-so. But nevertheless, the album still pleased me with its insanely catchy "Crazy in Love" and beautiful ballads like "Speechless" and "Me, Myself, and I." A DVD containing her live performace in Wembley was something I didn't expect myself to view, not to mention purchase. I never purchase a live DVD, but the price on Beyonce's DVD (which was very cheap) was something I couldn't pass up. And a bonus CD included was also applicable. And you still ask? Well... I wanted to see if Beyonce can spark more interest for me, as well as entertain me, and perhaps make me appreciate her solo album a bit more. Alas, she just about succeeded in all areas.She put on a very good performace. Her dances are unique and sexy. And she certainly got the crowd moving there. Playing songs from her solo album, tunes from movies she starred in, and a thoughtful Destiny's Child medly. At an hour and a half, she put on a good show. At times, it looked like she was lip-syncing ("Yes," anyone?) which kinda ruined it for me since I was always led to believe that she wouldn't stoop down to such a low level. But dancing and singing are hard to do at the same time, so I can't complain much there. She does indeed pull of insane dance moves, some of which would woo the viewer. The ballads she sings slow down the show, which is a minor gripe amongst those who've watched this show. I was pleased because I like those songs. "Speechless" was amazing for me to see. I was a bit disappointed that she didn't sing "Signs," but oh well, there's still plenty songs here to enjoy.The Destiny's Child medly was very much enjoyable. Certainly a major highlight of the performace and probably the best, in my humble opinion, of course. She talks to the crowd as well, keeping them rivited. She has a little "cheering contest" going on at one point, slowing down her performace, but at least she never forgets the fans. She loves her fans, unlike some one (*cough* Avril *cough*). Great dances, I loved her costumes and dresses, she sang pretty much most of the time (and her voice is still damn amazing), and overall, she gave a very good performace. Not great, just very good.The extra feautres are just behind the scenes of how the show was put together. From setting up how the show would run and Beyonce herself talks about what went down. It may not be much, but it's an interesting watch.And lastly, the bonus CD. Contains "Wishing on a Star," "What's It Gonna Be," "My First Time," and remixes of previous hits like "Krazy in Luv," "Baby Boy," and "Naughty Girl." I liked the first three tracks, especially "Wishing on a Star." Just absolutely beautiful. The remixes I'm not too fond of. These kind of dance, techno, or club beats don't appeal to me, and I think the songs were ruined. But that's just me. And I've read reviews here that Beyonce had recorded over 40 songs, just for her solo album alone. Maybe a "boxed set" would be released soon. I'm interesting in hearing them for myself.Anywho, the "Live at Wembley" DVD is well worth it. But if you've already seen Beyonce perform numerous times, it might be best to skip this. But I liked it. Very entertaining. It gets my thumbs up.
summary: Hmm... another cheap review of mine...

reviewText: If Beyoncé Knowles ever consider an alternative show business measuring her million dollars billboard charting career, she can simply model! Look at those legs, Naomi Campbell to watch out for, her Live at Wembley is the most overpowering concert show to any R&B; dance hip-hop female artistes in the past one year across Europe and America. The look of it is astonishingly hip to surpass any in-style critic. With the release of this DVD's dazzling cover packaging, Beyoncé sure uplifts her already mega star status with this delicate dolly image to a breathtaking level of success.Though her urban soul tune and glamorous outfit may go well altogether for the mass young listening crowd, I still find the only great song tailored for Beyoncé is and couldn't been other than CRAZY IN LOVE - which is also featured here in another hair-throwing thigh-shaking performace from the Brit Awards 2004. This act with the uptempo dance hit is not easily duplicated for many years to come. The rest of the songs are not so well to be remembered, and the remixes CD only serves more as a filler for value.
Title: N/A
